chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Rebecca Ann Newbury was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Rebecca Ann Newbury was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

As to both counts, Court ordered the defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

timeConds.notes: With Day Reporting Center and Huber privileges for work and treatment. Court objects to electronic monitoring.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca Ann Newbury in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Rebecca Ann Newbury.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED by operation of law. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense and Defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 2, with Huber privileges for work and treatment.   The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 3: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 1, with Huber privileges for work and treatment.   The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- As to Count 1, 4 MONTHS of condition time at the House of Correction with Day Reporting Center and Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court objects to electronic monitoring. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Operating privileges revoked for a period of 36 MONTHS. 
- Ignition interlock for a period of 36 MONTHS. 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. 
- 40 hours of community service. 

The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $600 as to Count 1 by the end of supervision.  As to both counts, Court ordered the defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given. 
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed: State's Offer Letter.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Character Letter

Defendant Rebecca Ann Newbury in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Rebecca Ann Newbury in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rebecca Ann Newbury in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek. BOTH APPEARED IN PERSON.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
